protocol_name: Phenol/chloroform extraction of DNA from cyanobacteria
protocol_name_html: Phenol/chloroform extraction of DNA from cyanobacteria
description: Phenol/chloroform-based DNA extraction from cells pre-treated with RNase A, lysozyme, proteinase K, and SDS. The protocol was optimized for extracting DNA from Microcystis aeruginosa, but works well for other cyanobacteria.
warning: See MSDS for safety and warnings.

groups.group_name: The Aquatic Microbial Ecology Research Group - AMERG (The Buchan, Zinser and Wilhelm labs)

status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data: Phenol/chloroform extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: Transfer aqueous (top) layer to clean Eppendorf tube without removing any of the organic layer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer aqueous (top) layer to clean Eppendorf tube without removing any of the organic layer.

components.data: Pre-treatment of cells with RNase A, lysozyme, proteinase K, and SDS
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Pre-treatment of cells with RNase A, lysozyme, proteinase K, and SDS

components.data: Add 25 µL of 100 mg/mL lysozyme for a final concentration of 5 mg/mL lysozyme.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 25 µL of 100 mg/mL lysozyme for a final concentration of 5 mg/mL lysozyme.

components.data: Phenol/chloroform extraction
components.name: Section

components.data:
• Repeat steps 10, 11 and 12 twice (a total of 3 phenol extractions) or until no visible protein layer is seen. 

 

  • Each time, remove the last of the aqueous layer along with some of the organic layer and add to the 're-extraction' Eppendorf tube (refer to step 14).
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
• Repeat steps 10, 11 and 12 twice (a total of 3 phenol extractions) or until no visible protein layer is seen. 

 

  • Each time, remove the last of the aqueous layer along with some of the organic layer and add to the 're-extraction' Eppendorf tube (refer to step 14).

source_data.label: At least 3 phenol extractions, or until no visible protein layer is seen.

components.name: Section

source_data.section: Pre-treatment of cells with RNase A, lysozyme, proteinase K, and SDS

components.data: Add 50 µL of 100 µg/mL RNase A TER buffer (RNase A plus TE buffer) for a final concentration of 10 µg/mL RNase A.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 50 µL of 100 µg/mL RNase A TER buffer (RNase A plus TE buffer) for a final concentration of 10 µg/mL RNase A.

components.data: Phenol/chloroform extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 250 mL chloroform/isoamyl alcohol (24:1), mix gently and completely.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 250 mL chloroform/isoamyl alcohol (24:1), mix gently and completely.

components.data: Phenol/chloroform extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 250 mL phenol (pH 8.0). Mix gently and completely.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 250 mL phenol (pH 8.0). Mix gently and completely.

components.data: Pre-treatment of cells with RNase A, lysozyme, proteinase K, and SDS
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Pre-treatment of cells with RNase A, lysozyme, proteinase K, and SDS

components.data: Add 50 µL of 10% sodium dodecyl sulfate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 50 µL of 10% sodium dodecyl sulfate.

components.data: Pre-treatment of cells with RNase A, lysozyme, proteinase K, and SDS
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Pre-treatment of cells with RNase A, lysozyme, proteinase K, and SDS

components.data: Add 50 µL of 1 mg/mL proteinase K for a final concentration of 100 µg/mL proteinase K.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 50 µL of 1 mg/mL proteinase K for a final concentration of 100 µg/mL proteinase K.

components.data: Phenol/chloroform extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: Repeat steps 16-18 to remove all phenol. (2/2)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Repeat steps 16-18 to remove all phenol. (2/2)

components.data: Phenol/chloroform extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: Transfer aqueous (top) layer to clean Eppendorf tube without removing any of the organic layer.(1/2)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer aqueous (top) layer to clean Eppendorf tube without removing any of the organic layer.(1/2)

components.data: Phenol/chloroform extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 500 µL of chloroform and mix gently.(1/2)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 500 µL of chloroform and mix gently.(1/2)

components.data: Ethanol precipitation
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 0.1 volume of 3 M sodium acetate to the collected aqueous phase and mix gently.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 0.1 volume of 3 M sodium acetate to the collected aqueous phase and mix gently.

components.data: Phenol/chloroform extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: Extract the mixed aqueous/organic contents of the 're-extraction' Eppendorf tube and follow extraction steps 10-19.  Combine the final aqueous layer with that collected above.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Extract the mixed aqueous/organic contents of the 're-extraction' Eppendorf tube and follow extraction steps 10-19.  Combine the final aqueous layer with that collected above.

components.data: Ethanol precipitation
components.name: Section

components.data: Add 2 volumes of ice cold 100% ethanol and gently mix well.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 2 volumes of ice cold 100% ethanol and gently mix well.

source_data.protocol_name_html: Phenol/chloroform extraction of DNA from cyanobacteria
source_data.annotation: Strings of precipitating DNA should become visible.
source_data.thread_text: Strings of precipitating DNA should become visible.
source_data.body: Strings of precipitating DNA should become visible.

components.data: Ethanol precipitation
components.name: Section

components.data: Place tube in -80 °C freezer until ethanol mixture is partially frozen (~1 hr.)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place tube in -80 °C freezer until ethanol mixture is partially frozen (~1 hr.)

source_data.title: approximate time for partial ethanol freeze

components.data: Ethanol precipitation
components.name: Section

components.data: Spin at maximum speed in benchtop centrifuge at 4 °C for 30 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spin at maximum speed in benchtop centrifuge at 4 °C for 30 min.

components.data: Ethanol precipitation
components.name: Section

components.data: Wash the DNA pellet by adding 500 µL of ice-cold 70% ethanol to the tube and pipetting it gently, several times.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the DNA pellet by adding 500 µL of ice-cold 70% ethanol to the tube and pipetting it gently, several times.

components.data: Ethanol precipitation
components.name: Section

components.data: Spin at maximum speed in a benchtop centrifuge at 4 °C for 15 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spin at maximum speed in a benchtop centrifuge at 4 °C for 15 min.

components.data: Ethanol precipitation
components.name: Section

components.data: Place in a heater block at ~37 °C for less than 5 minutes to evaporate all ethanol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place in a heater block at ~37 °C for less than 5 minutes to evaporate all ethanol.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 29 of Phenol/chloroform extraction of DNA from cyanobacteria
source_data.protocol_name: Phenol/chloroform extraction of DNA from cyanobacteria
source_data.protocol_name_html: Phenol/chloroform extraction of DNA from cyanobacteria
source_data.annotation: Be careful! DO NOT dry to completion!  Alternatively, you can air dry to remove the ethanol.
source_data.thread_text: Be careful! DO NOT dry to completion!  Alternatively, you can air dry to remove the ethanol.
source_data.body: Be careful! DO NOT dry to completion!  Alternatively, you can air dry to remove the ethanol.

components.data: Ethanol precipitation
components.name: Section

components.data: Re-suspend the DNA pellet in 50-100 µL of TE buffer or water (depending on downstream use and needed concentration).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Re-suspend the DNA pellet in 50-100 µL of TE buffer or water (depending on downstream use and needed concentration).

components.name: Section

source_data.section: Pre-treatment of cells with RNase A, lysozyme, proteinase K, and SDS

components.data: Concentrate ~4 mL of cellular culture in an Eppendorf tube by centrifugation at 10,000 xg for ~5 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Concentrate ~4 mL of cellular culture in an Eppendorf tube by centrifugation at 10,000 xg for ~5 min.

components.data: Incubate at 50 °C for 2 hr.

components.data: Phenol/chloroform extraction
components.name: Section

source_data.annotation: Longer spin times, (up to 10 min.) may help in separating the phases.

components.data: Phenol/chloroform extraction
components.name: Section

components.data: Remove the last of the aqueous layer along with some of the organic layer (to ensure all aqueous volume is collected) and add it to a new, clean Eppendorf tube for later re-extraction.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the last of the aqueous layer along with some of the organic layer (to ensure all aqueous volume is collected) and add it to a new, clean Eppendorf tube for later re-extraction.

components.data: Ethanol precipitation
components.name: Section

components.data: Discard supernatant and very carefully aspirate the remaining droplets of liquid from the tube without disrupting the DNA pellet.
